Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Issac outstanding care”
Reviews.Author: Sherri B
Reviews.Content: Avenue Plaza has been my favorite place to stay on St. Charles, clean, efficient, comfortable with especially nice showers. The staff have always been excellent; efficient and very prompt to attend me. This August my stay was extended through Hurricane Issac, during which the Avenue Plaza lost power but still gave exceptional care to its guests throughout. Flashlights, drinking water, hot coffee and barbequed burgers and franks were made available, with regular updates on the hurricane and accommodations. When the hurricane subsided and power could not be restored they relocated all of their guests (several busloads) to another lighted and comfortable Wyndham resort downtown. I am very grateful that I was at the Avenue Plaza during the hurricane, and very grateful to the wonderful staff who made the discomforts of this so minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Garden district”
Reviews.Author: Louise W
Reviews.Content: Arrived late 0200 after a long flight from Australia. Desk clerk was incredibly helpful with our check in and assisting us getting a meal locally. Good sized hotel room with 2 queen sized beds, very clean, an amazing laundry facility complete with large plasma TV. Daytime concierge a little unhelpful. Nice courtyard and pool area. Fantastic streetcar access from right outside the hotel only 10 minutes to bourbon st by streetcar and only $1.25 per trip. 10 or more cafes and pubs within walking distance most with reasonably priced meals. Blind pelican was good. Also take the streetcar away from city to Oak St. The Maple Bar on Oak has great entertainment on a Tueday. We saw a Grammie award winning big brass band. For breakfast you get good value for money at the streetcar cafe, and if you walk a little further there is a fantastic old style diner that have amazing breakfast and bottomless coffee. You can also walk to a convenience store about 50 meters, a Waldgrens, and a cosy bar 2 doors down that do take food, alcohol, and laundry open 24 hours. Great value for money hotel close to lots of amenities with easy city access.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip”
Reviews.Author: Shawn N
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable. We arrived really late but the valet for parking was right there waiting. Room was clean and spacious and bathroom was nice. The recommendations for restaurants were good. We experienced no problems and had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gulfstar76
Reviews.Content: Just returned home on Friday 10th, 2012. This was a really nice 1 bedroom suite. Very Clean,had all amenities you would want for a great stay. Someone said they didn't have a full size mirror in their suite, we did on the 9th floor. pool was nice, only half size but clean. Hot tub was very Hot, the way they should be, onsite people were very helpful and friendly. Steak house next to Ave. Plaza was very good. Take the bus or walk to a very nice supermarket called Fresh Market for local food shopping, excellant food , fresh breads, anythying you would want plus liquor up stairs. The Zoo was not worth the price, weather was soo Hot and Humid most were hiding in some shade.They also charge extra for the train ride and other activities. WW2 Museum was excellant, spent 7 hours at this , The movie which is $11.00 if your not a member or senior was a spare not expense show. very moving. The swamp tour with the boats with large fans to drive them was very good. Get a single bus pass each day, cheaper and if you loose it your not out a weeks worth of tickets. Cafe DuMond was OK, eat quick or the flys will get the food. French quaters flea market is typical, they pretty much all sell the same cheap goods, made in China. Some local goods like paintings and crafts can be found and bought for a high price. All in All a very interesting place.. watch out for the very large Roaches, they love the hot humid weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for St Carles getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Getgogonr
Reviews.Content: Great location for bar/ restaurant hopping on St Charles, nice and clean pool, fantastic steak house on site! Fun 24/7 bar next door for karaoke. Loved my stay for my birthday. Walk down to the Blind Pelican for drinks, 15$ taxi to quarter, great shopping on Magazine st.

Reviews.Title: “Get's the job done”
Reviews.Author: Frida A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Plaza Resort through our Worldmark timeshare. The hotel was just okay. It met our basic needs - having a place to sleep and a place to shower away all the NOLA humidity. Other than that, the room that we stayed in was out-of-date - worn down furniture, dim lighting, carpet flooring, etc. However, the location of this place was great! It's located in the Garden District and there's a trolley right outside the hotel. Had we known this, we would've opted out of getting a rental car - which by the way, we'd pay $$ for daily parking at the hotel. So for those of you looking to travel to NOLA, get the multiple day trolley pass! It's so worth it! Altogether, I would like to go back to NOLA. I'd only come back to this hotel if I was on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location outside of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Eric_S_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice hotel. We had a one bedroom suite and it came with a full kitchen with everything you would need. The beds and pillows were comfortable and the room temps could be adjusted easily. The A/C unit was pretty noisy when it was on however. We didn't get a chance to use the pool but the weight room is amazing! I was very impressed with the amount of machines and free weights. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. We did have to call down for fresh towels one day (being a time share they don't clean your room or refresh yoru towels) and the first lady at the front desk didn't seem interested in helping us so we called back an hour later and the gentleman that answered was very helpful and even called up an hour later to make sure we got our towels. The location is very nice. The St. Charles line stops right out front and it is about 2 miles from the French Quarter and even closer to the Garden District. We did try to get a late check out (noon vs. 10am) and was informed by the front desk that they do not do late checkouts on Fridays. This was a bummer as we had to spend 4hrs at the airport but policy is policy. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: Sgtmatt
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at almost midnight, we were greeted with smiles from a very pleasant and helpful staff. We had a one bedroom unit on the eighth floor. It was clean and spacious. There was a full mini kitchen with a full size refrigerator and two burner cooktop. It even had a small dishwasher. The living room had a sleep sofa, table with four chairs, an easy chair, coffee table and a large flat screen tv. A queen bed, night tables, a dresser and another flat screen tv made up the bedroom. The bathroom had a modern large shower, sink and toilet. The bathroom was small but fine for what you need a bathroom for. We had wonderful views from our eighth floor windows. The whole unit was clean and comfortable. We did utilize the resorts valet parking service. We feel this was well worth the charge. You drop off your car at the entrance to the resort and the valet parks your car in the private parking lot reserved for valet. When you need your car, just call from your room and your car is ready at the front door in ten minutes. The valets are friendly and courtious. To get around, there is public transportation that stops right in front of the resort. Unfortunately, the St Charles streetcar was down for maintenance so we had to use the city bus. A daily pass, for only $3.00, is good for unlimited rides on both the streetcars and bus for the entire day. The guest lounge, located by the pool, has hot coffee, iced tea and lemonade available to the guests every day. There are several nice restaurants close to the resort. A great place for breakfast is the Trolley Stop. Nothing fancy but good food at good prices and very generous servings. For dinner you have Copelands Cheesecake Bistro, VooDoo BBQ, Mia's and more. The resort has Mr. John's Steakhouse. Are there things that detract from this wonderful resort? Yes. The unit only has one mirror. It is the one in the bathroom and is only large enough to show your face. A full length mirror on the door would be a welcome addition. The resort says they have free wifi throughout the resort. They do, but it is so weak you can't connect to it. And if you do connect you lose the signal after 1 - 2 minutes. Our room fronted on St Charles Ave. There was minimal road noise from the normal traffic but when an ambulance went by (and there were many) the siren sounded like it was right in your living room. Soundproof windows would be nice. Overall, our stay at Avenue Plaza was a wonderful experience. The friendliness of the staff, the clean comfortable rooms, the location and the amenities of the resort outweigh the negatives. If we return to New Orleans, we will definitely stay at Avenue Plaza. I recommend it to anyone coming to New Orleans who wants a comfortable and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very friendly staff...until check-out time”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl12
Reviews.Content: We've been owners of Worldmark for nearly 16 years, but this was our first trip to Avenue Plaza. We booked two studios -- one for my husband and I and one for our friends traveling with us. The studios were furnished nicely, had kitchens, but no adequate mirror. The only mirror was the tiny mirror above the bathroom sink. To see myself fully dressed, I used the mirror out in the hallway by the elevator. Yeah, that was weird but it wouldn't prevent me from staying here again. The staff were overwhelmingly friendly, genuine and appreciative of us. Each morning, we received a "Good morning" when passing the front desk. Upon return in the evening, we received a, "Hello" or, "How was your day" or, "How are you?" All four of us literally felt like we were royalty simply based on the consistent friendliness we encountered. It was noticeable and appreciated. If what happened on our last morning could be erased from my mind, I'd give Avenue Plaza 5 stars. However, our last morning was not good. As Worldmark owners, our checkout time was Noon. For everyone else, checkout is at 10:00 a.m. Since it was our last morning, and our flights left in the late afternoon, we wanted to take this morning to sleep in and really relax in bed for the first time since we had been go-go-go for 4 days. At 9:45am we had a knock on our door from a housekeeping gentleman asking us when we planned to check out. My husband told him Noon. He thanked my husband and walked away. Around 10:30am, there was another knock. I answered this time. A housekeeping lady asked when we planned to check out. I asked her why she was the second person to knock on our door, and she just apologized. I told her we'd be out by Noon. Then, about 11am, we received a phone call asking when we planned to check out. My husband told the man that checkout time was Noon, so we'd be out by then. At that point, we both decided that they really wanted us out of there, so we packed everything up and left. It was hardly a relaxing morning with staff trying to get us to leave well before checkout time. Even given this, I'd stay here again, but at the start of my stay I would impress upon the staff to NOT bother us and pester us to leave the room on our last morning well before checkout. There are no "Do Not Disturb" signs for the doors, so I see no way around this other than to inform them ahead of time to stay clear of our room. I may actually bring my own sign to hang on the door on the last night. Other than that, I recommend this hotel -- well located right on the St. Charles Streetcar line and next to several eating options -- Cheesecake Bistro, Trolley Stop cafe, Igor's (a laundromat and bar) and a few pubs (Avenue Pub is good!) down the way. It's only a few block walk to Magazine Street as well, which is a great spot for a low-key stroll past the mansions of the Garden District. Stay here. You'll be happy!

Reviews.Title: “not an owner but treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Tour1252
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spend a weekend here while job hunting, school interviewing and house hunting. This was the perfect home base for all of our explorations. We have made many many trips to New Orleans but this was our 1st time staying outside of the Quarter. It was wonderful! The staff was amazing, so very nice. The rooms were spacious and well appointed, the beds very comfortable and everything upgraded and modern. Having the streetcar stop right out front made everything so easy. Would recommend this to anyone visiting this amazing city!!

Reviews.Title: “would love to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Cyan501
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for about 4 days with our timeshare exchange. the staff were friendly and helpful and the place was clean(newly renovated bathroom too). the bed was comfortable and the suite was spacious..but the best part of our stay was the location! it was right where the st charles streetcar stops in the garden district so we didnt have to drive around exploring NOLA (parking can be hard to find downtown unless to opt for pay parking).. there's a walgreens nearby and some good local restaurants like the voodoo barbecue as well as some fastfood places like kfc. it also has a pool area (we didnt get to hang out here because we were out exploring the city) and a fabulous roofdeck with a view of the city skyline!

Reviews.Title: “Love our timeshare!”
Reviews.Author: pirategirrl
Reviews.Content: We are owners of a studio unit, and were pleasantly surprised at how updated the room was since our stay 2 years ago. It's comfortable and looks more elegant than ever before. We love the location of the garden district, and like the convenience of the streetcar stopping just outside the resort. We had an issue with the a/c unit making some noise, but the maintenance crew came right away and were so polite and efficient. In this city, we tend to spend very little time in our room, but love the ability to bring back leftovers and store/reheat them. Our whole trip seems to revolve around eating, and we don't want to waste a bite! We walked around the garden district one day, and met a lovely homeowner who gave us the history of her home and the surrounding homes. People are just so friendly and every visit makes us feel like we've made new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Frankx4
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Avenue Plaza. We stayed 6 nights during the second weekend of Jazz Fest 2012 (May 2-8). The location was great and so easy to take the St. Charles street car. A plus for Jazz Fest attendees was that the city bus stopped right across from the hotel and took you right (with many stops, but that was a great way to see the city) to the fairgrounds where JF takes place. We stayed in a 1 bedroom and it was really nice, recently redone and clean. The kitchenette had everything you could possible need and had granite countertops, stainless appliances and some had looked like they had never been used! It was a bit pricey, but I guess that is just a product of coming during a very busy time. The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that the bathrooms are VERY small, like another reviewer said, no fan in bathrooms, and at the time we were there the pool/back patio area was closed because they were renovating. I think they could have done this during the winter vs. May, when the weather can be pretty HOT. I also would have appreciated some kind of notification when I made the reservation. I am not sure it would have made a difference, but I would have appreciated knowing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: AnnieH05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a deal through our in-laws time share. Having stayed in other time share resorts in SF, Kona, LV, Scottsdale, Orlando, and Whistler, BC, I would have to rate this as the best we have stayed in thus far. Great location, room, and amenities. Our only knock on the place was not having a fan in the bathroom. Â We stayed in the studio with a king bed...such a comfy bed, by the way. Â If we come back to NOLA we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gatorpappy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location,Trolly at front door. Very helpful staff,clean comfortable rooms.....will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in the Garden District”
Reviews.Author: RobinRose
Reviews.Content: Loved our 4 night stay here! Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was courteous and accommodating. The Garden District is a lovely oasis outside of the frenzy of the French Quarter. Beautiful neighborhood right on the trolley line and access to everywhere. Would absolutely recommend to others and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: catalan_traveler
Reviews.Content: This place is great - right in front of the street car stop, in beautiful St Charles Ave. The staff are very nice, and rooms are big, clean and with everything you might need. There was only one problem with my room and it had to do with the constant noise that came from the A/C and other motors at the back of the hotel. My room was on the 5th floor, so I imagine that if you get a room in a higher floor, not facing the motors, this will not be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MMMc55
Reviews.Content: When selecting this hotel consideration was given to the location, price and amenities required. The Avenue Plaza resort didn't disappoint. It is located in the Garden District along St Charles Ave. It is far enough away from the French Quarter and CBD in a quieter suburb, yet close enough to hop on a streetcar and be there in 10 minutes, less the hassle of trying to park or pay for the privilege in expensive car parks. However, word of warning, streetcars during busy periods can be very crowded and unpleasant. Also be sure to say to the driver you want a day pass, (if you want one which is the best option), before putting money into the ticket machine. Or else you'll be yelled at! (Albeit in Southern good humor). The hotel offers valet parking but enough free parking can be found on the street within easy access to the hotel. The room we stayed in was a one bedroom suite on the 10th floor with foldout bedding in the lounge in addition to the big bedroom. It was very clean, the kitchenette was excellent and the view from the suite window was fantastic. For an even better view, the rooftop terrace accessed from the 12th floor is great for a panoramic view of New Orleans and suburbs. Reception desk assistance was disappointing, I asked where I might find the nearest post office and was told to wait for the tour desk manager, who never appeared. Porters were sought, by repeated requests over a lengthy period but never came to assist. Laundry appliances were unreliable, but as I don't like to judge a vacation by doing a mundane chore like laundry, whilst on it, I perhaps should let that pass! LOL. Plentiful restaurants and convenience stores are closeby. The business centre in the hotel had three computer terminals to access internet 24/7. Lifts worked efficiently and the outdoor areas were good. Overall a pleasant stay in a comfortable and well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: wicnstic
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely resort. The beds are wonderful, the kitchen is just enough and the bathroom, though small is very efficiently set up with a large shower. The entire staff are very nice. This was our 10th visit to New Orleans and it was also our first stay in the Garden District. It was a good respite from the craziness of the French Quarter but still has plenty of grown up bars and shopping and good restaurants. This will definitely be were I will stay again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory room, unsatisfactory service”
Reviews.Author: Mortsy
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the beautiful Garden District looking forward to an enjoyable stay at the Avenue Plaza Resort. Our studio unit was large and nicely furnished. However our one-week stay was marred by the indifferent, unfriendly and unhelpful attitude of the resort staff. When we arrived, we were asked to pay $45.00 in advance for cleaning â€“ not cleaning the unit during our stay, but preparing the unit for the next guestsâ€™ arrival after our departure. There was no midweek cleaning, tidying, or replacing towels, toiletries and linens, as we have enjoyed and other hotels and resorts in the past. At Avenue Plaza Resort we were asked to carry our used towels down two floors by elevator, where we were able to exchange them for clean dry towels; similarly when the soap and shampoo ran out, we were invited to visit the reception desk in the lobby and carry the toiletries back to our unit. Sort of like an expensive summer camp for kids. These grownups will not be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: Vivian C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days over Easter 2012 in a one bedroom suite. The hotel is in the lovely Garden District of New Orleans and having the trolley stop right at our front door is a real bonus. Our suite was spacious and comfortable with good kitchen facilities. It was really diasappointing that the swimming pool's hot tub did not work. Only 1 of the 4 dryers in the laundry room actually worked properly to dry the clothes. Most hotel staff were quite friendly and helpful during our stay. However, it was really unsatisfactory that despite 4 calls and waiting 40 minutes, no porter came to assist with our luggage when checking out. Luckily I did not wait any longer as our car was parked at the front of the hotel waiting for more than 30 minutesl. (We had 4 heavy suticases as we were travelling home to Australia). In my opinion, this hotel would need to improve as currently it's not really good value for money (about $200 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: LarJayPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Plaza offers very comfortable accommodations in a great location. The St. Charles streetcar stops right in front of the hotel every 10-15 minutes during the day and takes you to the heart of downtown and the French Quarter. Several good restaurants are located within walking distance and the Garden District is also only a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Five days of fun!”
Reviews.Author: FPTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great home base to the Greater NOLA area. The front desk and porters were super nice and extremely helpful. The valet parking system works great. You can call ahead and have your car waiting for you at the front door. We are owners of a one week timeshare @ Ave Plaza but this was our first trip since Katrina. All the room have been updated with new furnishing and appliances. The pool and spa are still works in process but it all should be up and going by the end of June 2012. The trolley stops across the street from the Plaza's front door which makes going to the Quarter a snap. Also, fairly close on St. Charles Ave there are several good places to dine without doing to far from your front door. The Irish House and VooDoo BBQ are our picks both are about 1/2 mile from the hotel. (easy walk) The Trolley Stop Cafe about 1/2 "block" from Ave Plaza is good basic breakfast that is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Our hats off the this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Parisbyday2
Reviews.Content: From the time we stepped out of our car to hand over our keys to the time we left we were treated like royalty. The porters, Kevin and Mr. Turner were exceptional and made us feel most welcome especially after travelling 11 hours in the car. We stayed in a studio with a king bed and full kitchen, dressing area and shower. All were very clean. We exchanged our time share and this was definitely a pleasant surprise. The Resort is in a residential area right on the St. Charles trolley line. We purchased a Jazzy Pass at Walgreens down the street and never needed our car.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LincolnHS
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay. Service was wonderful. Everyone was very pleasant. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Treasure and Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Kristy L
Reviews.Content: Intially I had booked this hotel because it was located in a great place and the price was not bad compared to others in the area. I had noticed the reviews were also pretty good, but nobody ever said how amazing it really was. It might not be a 5 star rated hotel, but to me it deserves it. I have to admit from the outside it does not seem to special, but once you walk in you are taken back by the lovely marble floors and also the wonderful customer service. Everybody from the front desk to the valet was awesome and knew how to treat their customers...we stayed there 4 nights and each and every night was awesome. New Orleans is just a great city, but staying at this hotel made it evern better. I plan to come back and I would love to stay here again....the room had everything we needed, plus the shower was really nice. We had enough pillows on our bed to make you feel like 10 were sleeping in the bed and plus the beds were really cozy. I just gotta say I really loved the place and it deserves a big thumbs up!!!! Way to go Avenue Plaza Resort......I promise to be back soon. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pyschokitty
Reviews.Content: We were there for the NCAA finals and chose this hotel because of the great location. The streetcar stops right outside and is a very easy and economical way to get around the city. We thought our room was awesome - very clean, updated and because we had a suite, very roomy! Yes the bathroom is very small but the shower was great with the rain showerhead! Have to admit I was nervous after reading the review about the cockroaches but we did not have that problem at all. We thought this place was a class act from the front desk, to the pool and to the accommodations - remember though that there is no maid service if that is a priority on your list! We went down to the corner market (1/2 block away) and stocked up on some munchies, had a drink every night at Igors - also a half block away - where we rubbed elbows with some of the locals and also had breakfast at the Trolley Stop and The Tavern (we liked this one the best!). We had drinks on the rooftop which gave us a great view of the city. Would also like to add how friendly the people of New Orleans are - we are already talking about a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “A little better than we expected, but still with some definite flaws”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: We had tickets for the NCAA finals but left our hotel booking a little late. However, friends were able to snag rooms at the Avenue Plaza Resort for a decent rate. Judging by the hotel's site and TA reviews we weren't expecting much, but the hotel was actually a decent size and the room decor wasn't as dated as the various pictures suggested. Our rooms had practically full kitchens, so a couple could stay there pretty comfortably for an extended time if they wanted to save some money on dining out. One complaint about the room was that for 24 hours we experienced a weird problem with the shower where the water simply wouldn't get hot, regardless of how the knob was turned. Eventually, with the knob cranked to 'H', the water would get warm (not hot) after about ten minutes. Then, before we could raise the issue it fixed itself. By far the biggest problem, though, was the noise the air conditioner made. The AC unit was set inside a wall near the bathroom and close to the bed, and when it ran (which was all the time...it was 85+ degrees all weekend) it rattled. LOUDLY. That made it very difficult to sleep. Unfortunately, because of when we were there, there were no other available rooms to which to move. It was annoying at best, and sleep-ruining at worst. The front desk staff and concierge were friendly and generally helpful, though not quite as professional as I'd expect. Granted, I can only imagine the kind of busy weekend they were having with all the out-of-town basketball fans around, but I suspect the level of service and professionalism didn't change at the uber-busy hotels in the CBD. I didn't know much about the Garden District and thought we'd be in no man's land all weekend, but it was actually great. There are two great breakfast places a stone's throw from the hotel (the very popular Trolley Stop Cafe for big greasy breakfasts, and the Avenue Cafe right next door to the Trolley Stop for smaller breakfasts and better coffee), one of the best beer places (the Avenue Pub) in North America a few blocks down and the St. Charles streetcar right out the front door of the hotel which takes you to the WWII museum or Canal Street in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: asilverbullet58104
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for 9 days and the service is absolutely horrible. After a long day of travel, I checked in after midnight and it took over 20 minutes to check in. The key verification wasn't system wasn't working. When they finally got my gets programmed, I went up to my room then walked down to get a soda. You need a key to get into the vending area. My key wouldn't work. Went back downstairs do get the key reprogrammed. This went on the entire stay for 9 days. I was on the 6th floor and everyday when I would return to my room the keys wouldn't work. I was so frustrated by day 3 and told the staff I was fed up with it. All they would say is "They will work now." This staff is so incredibly lazy and don't care about providing customer service. Never once did I hear "Thank you" or "I'm sorry about the inconvenience." Upon checkout I was not even thanked or asked how my stay was. Also wireless internet didn't work. When I asked why, of course all I got was "We have a business center available." I went into the business center and 2 of the 3 computers didn't work. I went back to the desk and the girl said they knew about it but had no idea how to fix them. Just an absolute mess. The reason I even gave this place 2 stars is because it has been recently renovated and very nice. For the price of this place, seriously go stay at the Marriott, Harrahs or the Sheraton. Same price and great customer service there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: stalco
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and clean and well appointed with tv, kitchenette, etc. Great shower. Even though this is a timeshare there was no pressure to buy. All staff went out of there way to be helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: LSUstew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two best friends just stayed here for Mardi Gras. Nearly everything from the time we arrived to the time we checked out was absolutely perfect! The entire staff was helpful and courteous, the room was clean and just as it was described online, and the balcony was the perfect location for watching the parades away from the chaos of street level. The only issue we had (and it really wasn't a huge deal) was that the resort does not have as many parking spaces as it does rooms. Since they were completely booked due to the holiday, by the time we arrived, we were not able to valet our car. Fortunately, there are ample places in the area to park. With the resort being directly on the parade routes, we were slightly concerened about the crowds on the balcony or courtyard areas. They do a good job of controlling that though with each guest being required to wear a colored wrist band (each day was a different color). Registered guests' bracelets are included in the price of the room and our visitors were able to purchase bracelets for $20 per day. This kept the crowds within the property at a reasonable level. The layout of the room was nice (studio suite) with the kitchen on one side, restroom on the other, a dining area near the large window, and a seperate space for storing luggage. We opted for two queen beds since our friends were staying with us and did not feel crowded at all. I had broken my ankle the night before our stay so was confined to a wheelchair and crutches for the duration. The staff was VERY helpful, opening doors for us, holding elevators, making sure everything was just right. The courtyard by the guest lounge is a great, quiet place to sit and enjoy coffee in the morning. I really just can't say enough positive things about this place! We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Room Quality vs. Staff Service”
Reviews.Author: granny11_12
Reviews.Content: What an unpleasant experience. All excited to be in New Orleans for Mardi Gras weekend. Check in was a nightmare. Staff at the front desk were dazed and confused and unpleasant Arm bands were required to get in and out of the building, our guests were treated like second class people, the security even grabbed my grand daughter's arm to tighten her arm band so much that it cut the circulation in her arm. I complained to management, but the next day, they did the same thing to my son-in-law. Arm bands for guests cost $20.00 each for each day. This was salt in the wound. I have never stayed anywhere where I had to pay for guests to visit me while in town. We paid $1970.00 for five nights. I would say the room was nice, but the torture of dealing with the staff was so unpleasant it nearly ruined our experience. I absolutely hated going in and out of the place. For the money we paid to be treated like that was horrible. Every day was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: Russell B A
Reviews.Content: Room and amenities were all great. Most of these extra items we did not use. Did not realize it was a time share. The telephone and desk staff were patient and courteous. Baggage men were excellent but don't know how much to tip them. The concierge staff was great but they seem to want sell you something. AC was not working but they fixed it right away. $20 fee for parking was questionable but it's safe and better than getting a parking ticket or your car towed. If Mardi gras parades went in front of the hotel it would have been a lot better. Steak restaurant was closed but the Trolley Stop next door was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great one bedroom suite.”
Reviews.Author: mayansunloungers4
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite that was recently redone all the furniture and appliances seemed quite new. For 3 of us staying in unit it was enough space. All the staff we encountered we're very helpful. Best thing was the trolley car stop right across the street. Very quick to get you down to the french quarter . Our favorite places were on Frenchman street . Drinks and eats at The Three Muses and also listened to some good music at The Spotted Cat. It was very busy when we were there so we walked a lot and never felt unsafe. All in all it was a great stay and we would stay at Avenue Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for family stay”
Reviews.Author: avnis
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. It's perfect if you want to be at quiet place, away from the noise and also in the middle of french quarters and University and garden district area. Street Car stop is right in front of the hotel which is very convenient. We are in 1 BR suit and had a full kitchen, Nice comfortable bed. Loved their Gym. We went in x-mas week and it was in 60s out side but their pool was on with steaming water. very warm water. Nice roof deck but couldn't enjoy as it was cold. Verify friendly staff. I will certainly go back to stay at Avenue Plaza resort. The concierge helped us out to plan our days and recommended different places to visit, book our city tour etc. It 's fully renovated and our unit had brand new carpet, bed, furniture and kitchen appliances. Even the whole way carpet still smelled fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Ludovica34
Reviews.Content: Friends and I spent a week at the Avenue Plaza earlier this month. We found the hotel to be very well located. It's situation in the Garden district makes it very easy and pleasant to take in the wonderful heritage homes in the area. The St Charles streetcar stops in front which makes it simple to reach the French Quarter etc. from the hotel. There are shops and some excellent restaurants close by. The suite itself was nicely furnished and well- stocked. A minor inconvenience was that there was only one mirror in the WC (slowed things down in the morning).The hotel offers complimentary coffee and other beverages all day which one can enjoy in the courtyard or by the lovely pool. The staff were pleasant, helpful and very polite. We were very happy with our visit to New Orleans and our stay at the Avenue Plaza clearly contributed to our enjoyment of this beautiful and interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: QueenMeow48
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautifully decorated for Christmas, and our unit was spacious and sparkling clean. It appeared to have been recently redone - no wear/tear on any of the furnishings or linens. The room had plenty of thick towels, 6 bed pillows, good bed linens, flat-screen TV. Amenities included popcorn and hot cocoa mix. And, of course, because this is a timeshare, the kitchen area included dishwashing detergent, coffee/sugar/creamer, etc. The concierge and front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. And the bed was VERY comfortable - something valued after a busy day of seeing the sights and being out and about NOLA. The hotel has a good in-house steak restaurant and is located right next to the Cheesecake Bistro - Yum! If you want a "locals diner" type meal, walk up another block past Copeland's and stop in the Trolley Car Cafe. Others have remarked about hearing noise from the hallway and other guests, but we did not experience that, even though it was a crowded holiday time. It's right on the St. Charles historic streetcar line - just exit right out of the resort, walk up to the corner, cross over to the median and the streetcar stop is right there. It's only $3/day to ride the entire line and get on/off as many times as you wish, wherever you wish. If you'd prefer a cab, the front desk will order one for you, and the one-way fare to go all the way over to the French Market was only about $8.

Reviews.Title: “Need to have appropriate expectations”
Reviews.Author: rsnash
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Avenue Plaza at least 5 times and am a timeshare owner there. After reading some of the reviews, I wanted to point out a few things. Staff: While there is no excuse for rude front desk clerks some have complained about, I have never had this experience here. It isn't a high-end luxury resort where the staff are ultra professional and say "My Pleasure!" every time you ask them for anything. Frankly, that phoniness annoys me. The staff here are generally locals and nice, usually young, people. Valet Parking: Someone mentioned parking around the corner for free, but I prefer to valet park at Avenue Plaza. It has one of the least expensive daily parking rates of any timeshare in New Orleans. There are a couple that have free parking, but if it's free, you have to park your car yourself, usually in an adjacent garage. I like the valet service at AP. I call down when I'm almost read to leave, and our car is out front waiting for us by the time we get downstairs. When you have packages it's great to be able to pull right up front. The valet guys are really nice and we've never had any theft issues with our cars. Pool - It's one of the nicest at a timeshare, but it is not heated and the spa tub doesn't work and isn't heated either. But it is a nice area to relax and if it's the summer, you really don't want it heated! I just wish it were heated for our winter time visits. Laundry - Not only is does the bar next door double as a laundromat. There is a washer and dryer on every other floor. Free to use. Buy or bring your own detergent. No need to over pack! Internet - Wifi can be iffy in the rooms, usually worse than most hotels, which is never very good anyway. Better service available in the computer room, to the left of the front desk. Spa - There's a spa. I haven't used it. View - The rooms facing St. Charles are all 1 Bedrooms. The bedrooms have a queen sized bed. We like a King sized bed. They are only available as studio units. Some studios have 2 double beds instead, but the room is no bigger, so those feel cramped to me and my husband, so we just take a Kind Studio. Definitely go up to the room and enjoy the view from there. Bathrooms - Were all upgraded over the last few years. Many people complain that they are cramped, but believe me, they are better than they used to be! The main shower-head is a rain type directly over head, but there is also a handheld unit, so you can switch to that one if you don't want to get your hair wet. There is also a nice and convenient public restroom area to the left of the elevators, jic you get back from touring and more than one person has to "go"! We've been to New Orleans many many times, feel free to write and ask me questions! Rachel

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER BARGAIN STAY”
Reviews.Author: llittle
Reviews.Content: this time i had a studio unit, all units are non-smoking and nice. had the papa noel rate of $40+ tax, so it was a super bargain stay. if you want daily maid service it is extra, you can get towels, if needed. this is my second stay and both have been great. all of the people there are nice and helpful, except for the guy who checked me in, and apparently was having a bad day. why they would put somebody like that in contact with the public is amazing to me. it is a time share, but when you book it as a hotel, you are not involved in any of that. down the street is the trolley stop cafe, and they still have a good $2.99 breakfast special. the streetcar stops right outside the door, allow plenty of time to get where you are going. get day passes for the streetcars and busses for $3.00/day. i made my first trip to new orleans in 1972 and have been there 9 out of the last 10 decembers, will be happy to give you any information i have about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly knowledgeable staff, great accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: Patricebill1
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving, I called numerous times at different times of day and the staff was always friendly and answered my questions accurately. My husband and I decided to take our 15 year old daughter and 9 year old son to New Orleans to weeks before Christmas as their Christmas present. We booked the Avenue Plaza Resort through our timeshare exchange group and started planning our trip. We arrived around 9:30 in the morning and they had no problem storing our luggage and recommending somewhere really good to eat and get our trip started. None of us had been to New Orleans before and I had questions about transportation. We opted to use the streetcar, which was very economical at $3 per day and very convenient. The pick up was right in front of the resort and they were obviously the method of transportation for many of the locals, who were very friendly and helpful. The St. Charles streetcar went all the way to Canal Street, where it was extremely easy to get anywhere in the city. Our room was on the 6th floor and was more than adequate. It was clean and had everything we needed for a 5 night stay. I read a review where someone complained about the overhead shower head, not a problem, because that was easily turned off and the hose turned on. Someone else mentioned the water not getting hot, not true in our case, the water was perfect. We were not on the St. Charles Street Side, our view was of the Superdome which was great. We did not use the pool or hot tub, as it was in the 40s most of our stay. We did sit in the lounge a few times, which was a very cozy and comfortable place to be. We used the laundry facilities while we were there, which were nicer than expected. One of the many highlights of our entire trip was the fact that every time we returned to our resort, we were greeted by a pleasant, professional, and knowledgeable employee that always had a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough property but the trolley into the city isn't that great”
Reviews.Author: golfslw
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Avenue Plaza. The location is up St. Charles Avenue, at the border of the Garden District which is quite nice and I recommend the Historical Tour. The biggest problem is the trolley service which is irradic at best. Yes it looks quaint and is nice if it is not packed and comes when you need it. However, the reality is that it can be packed in the mornings and evenings, and they tend to get bunched up so that there will be 3 in a row and then none for a long time. Also there are no benches or awnings to cover you if it rains. When you get on, each person has to pay $1.25 or $3 for a day pass (a good deal) or scan their pass. This takes a long time because the machine isn't very good and often doesn't take some dollar bills or read the legitimate passes. As for the resort, our king room was nice with a well equipped small kitchen and was quiet. It was not located on St. Charles St. and overlooked the pool, which looked fine but was small and we didn't use because it was cold when we were there. The bathroom was tiny, and only had a small 18" by 24" mirror at best. So don't think about seeing how you look before you go out. Also the shower head is directly over your head, so you will need to bring a shower cap if you don't want to wash your hair that day (they do not provide one). You could hear people in the halls once in a while but that was not really a problem because that was not too late at night or too early. As for some great things to do in New Orleans. Eat of course. Also, the Jean Lafitte Historical Society's free tour of New Orleans is excellent, as is the Garden District tour by Historical New Orleans Tours. We also enjoyed the Natches Riverboat cruise and the Sculpture Garden in the City Park area. There is also a museum and botanical gardens at City Park, but we didn't have enough time, since we were enjoying the food at Cafe Degas down the block, excellent but pricey. I would use the 91 bus to get to City Park rather than take the St. Charles trolley and Canal St. trolley that everyone will recommend that you take. The Canal St. trolley to City Park only runs every 40 minutes. The one to the Cemeteries runs very frequently but that is the wrong one for City Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great place unless you want to be really close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MrsCJR
Reviews.Content: My sister and brother and I met in NO to celebrate my sister's birthday. The three of us stayed in a one bedroom unit and didn't feel crowded. My sister and I shared the bed (which was comfortable and plenty big enough) and my brother slept on the hide-a-bed. Everything was clean, we didn't notice anything unusual or badly constructed in our room, and the staff was quite friendly (except one guy that we only saw once right before we left). Didn't have any problems with the elevators, and never saw the staff in them. We heard a little bit of construction noise once or twice during the day, but nothing serious. There was a full-length mirror in the bedroom in addition to the one over the sink in the bathroom (other reviews complained about lack of mirrors - perhaps this was in a studio room?). Also had no problems connecting to the internet from our room. The only real complaints we had were with the water temperature in the shower, and the shower set up in our room. The temperature rarely got above barely warm (although it was not ice cold), and only once or twice did it get anything close to hot. Also, we somehow ended up in an "accessible" room, and there was no separate shower in the bathroom - there were drains on the floor and the shower head was on the wall - not even a shower curtain! It would have been OK except no one else could be in the bathroom if someone else was showering - modesty aside, you would get soaked from the spray! My sister and I usually share the bathroom and one can use the sink/mirror while the other is showering, but this set-up slowed us down when we were trying to get ready and out the door for the day. We liked the neighborhood - it was kind of nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter. We also really appreciated having the streetcar right outside the door - saved a lot of money in transportation costs! You do need to be a little patient with the timing of the streetcars (especially late at night) and be prepared to stand when it's crowded. Zara's grocery store (a few blocks away) was the best one we found (more selection than the one St. Charles, which I think was Williams Market). Zara's is not a "supermarket," but had a better selection than the other one if you are planning to do any cooking in your room. There were a few restaurants within walking distance on St. Charles, but we didn't get a chance to try any of them (we mostly ate in the French Quarter). There's also a Walgreens nearby (easy walk for an able-bodied adult). We got a nice little packet from the concierge for a self-guided walking tour of the historic Garden District homes, and this is a great option for the budget-conscious who don't want to pay for a tour. Note that only one home is open for indoor tours, and it's only open on Mondays (New Orleans Opera Women's Guild Home on Prytania St, $7 pp). Lafayette Cemetery is within walking distance and seemed perfectly safe during daylight hours (it closes at 2:30 pm). We rode the streetcar to the end of the line toward the Upper Garden District/Uptown neighborhoods, and if you go at a time of day that's not crowded so you can sit down, it was a great way to see the architecture - we thought many of the homes we saw were more impressive than the ones near the hotel that get so much attention. We took a walk in the residential area at the end of the line and saw some really cool houses. Highly recommend booking Charles Ritz Enterprises for transportation to/from the airport - same price as a cab but his vehicle is much nicer/cleaner. We were running late on our way back to the airport (and it was at the start of rush hour), but he knew the shortcuts and still got us to the airport in just over 30 minutes. Also: Our mother is a Worldmark owner, and in other Worldmark stays we've been pressured to attend a presentation, but that didn't happen here.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping not included”
Reviews.Author: carolinaexplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a destination wedding 2 weeks ago. On the positive side, the location is great. Its just a short walk to Magazine Street. It's near the trolley and really in the center of the Zoo and the French Quarter. The rooms are nice and clean BUT the only mirror in the room was in the bathroom and could not have been larger than 24 inches. We heard some members of the wedding party had a full length mirror installed so we called and were told there were no more. We had to go out to the elevators to use the large mirrors there!!!!The other surprise to us was that there is no housekeeping service during your stay unless you want to pay 94 dollars extra per day!!! Overall, we found the room comfortable , clean and located well.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, comfortable, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LKS11
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i've stayed here as a guest of a family member who has a time share. Our rooms were more updated than last year, which was a nice touch. We had to switch rooms our last day, be were moved up to a one bedroom. The studio is perfectly roomy for two people. Very quiet and dark in room for sleeping. Quick ride to quarter on streetcar, when it comes. Otherwise jump in a cab for less than $10. Or go uptown on the streetcar or by bus on Magagzine. (go to Surrey's on Magazine for breakfast. If you like beer at all, visit the Avenue Pub on St Charles for over 20 beers on tap and funky art and balconies) We see a lot more of the city statying here since it's a more central location. Service was just fine. Nice to have a kitchen to use! Check out the roof top deck, nice view of the city. I priced a lot of hotel and B & B's, seems like a very good rate for what you're getting!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was very nice as was our visit in May, 2011. We like being between the French Quarter and Audubon Park & Zoo.”
Reviews.Author: Flashfried
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The staff always helpful. We love Mr. John's Steakhouse which is just off the main lobby of Avenue Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gail B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the first thing I did was sink down on the bed - and I do mean "sink." It was so soft that I had visions of that old Lucy episode. But as I relaxed, I realized that I wasn't slouching down - I was well supported. I dropped off instantly and slept two hours. I have insomnia, so any time I sleep away from home, I have problems. Not here. Every single night of our 7 night stay, I slept like a log. So. Great bed. The staff was friendly and attentive - each time we called to ask for anything, whether it was coffee, cream, toilet paper - whatever, someone knocked on our for within 10 minutes. Someone held the for open for us each time we left or returned. Nice touch. They also made helpful suggestions for everything from good local restaurants to activities, and even helped us book a tour. They also educated us on use of the streetcars (NEVER call them trolleys) - a day pass lets you ride any RTA streetcar or bus for the measly price of $3, and you can get anyplace in the city that way (you will need to walk in the French Quarter - or rent one of the little bubbly looking two seat cars). There are stops going both directions literally just out front. The room itself had a nice big screen tv - a good 40-incher. It also had a refrigerator, a 2-burner cooktop, and a decent complement of plates, pots, pans and other cooking stuff. The bathroom was tiny but functional, and we were very comfortable all week. The street is a genteel, lovely, quiet one, with old oaks lining it most of the way into town. The hotel sits at the edge of the Garden District in a very romantic setting. All in all, we had a wonderful time, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance”
Reviews.Author: timoray
Reviews.Content: I LOVE New Orleans! I love everything about the place because it is unlike any other city in America. When you are in New Orleans--you KNOW you are in New Orleans and not some strip malled city cut out by a development corporation. I always stay at the Wyndham La Belle Maison but this year for Halloween it wasn't available so we stayed at Avenue Plaza. We loved it! It's quieter for sure and the feel of the Garden District is way different than the feel of Bourbon Street but since it is right on the streetcar line (don't call it a trolley), you can be down to the French Quarter in about 15 minutes. The streetcar runs 24/7, although less frequently at late night. There are good restaurants in the area. Jackon's over on Magazine street is one of them. For a more informal experience, you have to go to Voodoo BBQ just a couple of blocks down St. Charles toward the Quarter. It was Halloween so we did a ghost tour. It's basically an historical tour. It's interesting but don't expect to do a seance or anything like that. But do visit the St. Louis cemetary. The history there is incredible. And do go to Frenchman's street to hear the music that New Orleanians listen to. OK, now for the hotel. It was far better than I thought it would be. We had a 1/1. The building is old and rennovated. I loved the shower and the appointments are really nice. The garden and the pool in the back are pleasant but not like a mega resort. My ONLY complaint was with the really curt person who checked us in. She acted like we were way too much trouble to bother with. Everyone else was really friendly and helpful. We parked on the street around the corner free to avoid valet charges. I don't know how secure that is and I took EVERYTHING out of my car. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very average place”
Reviews.Author: par521
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we had to wait in our car for over 15 minutes while a spot was cleared by the three valet/bellman. They were working hard, but were severely understaffed. Actually these gentlemen were the most helpful and friendly of any of the staff. The reception staff varied in their competence and willingness to help. Can't say much for the others as the only other staff I had contact with was the indifferent woman sitting with the towels which we had to exchange between 8 & 9 or 3 & 4. Who came up with this system? We had a one bedroom corner room where the internet only worked in the itty-bitty bathroom or a small corner of the bedroom. The bedroom was clean and comfortable as was the rest of the place, but had only one reading lamp in the living area. Anyone sitting on the couch had no access to light. The trolley line was very close as was a place to eat breakfast. The restaurant attached to the Avenue was very good, but also very expensive. Wish I had known most of these things before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kathy G
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a studio. The kitchen and bathroom were top notch. Loved the granite counter tops and high quality appliances. Coffee in the common area was nice touch. The pool area was lovely and there were always chairs open. We were right on the streetcar line and just blocks from the Magazine street shops and restaurants. The sun deck on the 12 floor was awesome every afternoon for enjoying a drink while checking out the city. Staff were very accomodating. The only complaint was the loud elevator that our room was close to - but still an awesome value and really nice stay. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: AlpineCowgirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week long stay here.The only real negative is the bathroom is extremely small. No full length mirror or make up mirror. The staff are nice and helpful. The towel exchange at certain hours, is silly. Easy access to the trolley. beautiful area. There is a spa on the second floor, no brochures or any signs to know there is one there in hotel? We found it by accident. No one came out to greet us, no info on services? Also a balcony on second floor, for a nice view out front with patio furniture.The top floor/roof has a great view,and photo op but needs more furniture or better set up to really spend time there.

Reviews.Title: “"Resort" is pushing it”
Reviews.Author: JerryG999
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1-bedroom suite, offering a decent size for the location, which is fairly convenient, but probably not walkable (~1.5 miles) from the French Quarter (especially at night). But it is on the streetcar line, and riding that is fun in itself. I'd consider this on-par with a 2.5 * - 3 * hotel: clean, comfortable, a few amenities, but not a "luxury" or resort-quality hotel in the grade or room, amenities, or service (although the fitness center was quite large and well-equipped). The Internet access was poor, possibly because of insufficient bandwidth for the number of users (since it was easier to connect very late at night). The "heated" pool was very small, and, judging by the water temperature, was probably heated only by the sun. Elevator service could have been better, and it seems that there is no separate elevator for staff (which just slows it down a bit more). The concierge comes on a bit strong with the offer of a free riverboat dinner cruise in exchange for enduring a time-share presentation (although he's only doing his job and took "no" for an answer the first time). I stayed with a friend who booked it through his time-share plan, so I cannot comment on the value (as I have no idea what it cost). But my impression is that this is NOT a screaming bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value.”
Reviews.Author: scarletd0g
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service here need a lot of improvement. Although there were recent renovations, the planning was poor and rooms are not very relaxing. There is no easy chair or sofa and the lighting is poor. Service is non existent and numerous calls must be made to get assistance with anything that is wrong.

Reviews.Title: “there for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: hezzypoo
Reviews.Content: Was a guest for a wedding. Can you imagine getting ready for a wedding without any mirrors in the room. Yes, only above the sink - the only mirror. Very inconvenient to walk out into the hallway to check ones outfit when the mirrors were located by the elevators. Bad planning. Very comfortable beds. Small bathroom and shelf above the toilet- come on- could have lost many items down the stool, so kept all my toiletries in the bedroom. For the price- and we were there not as a time share owner- it would be nice to have some breakfast items available as the price of the room surely would have been adequate to cover some for the non-time share guests. Was a good location for catching the trolley and getting around. Felt like the neighborhood was very safe. Good food in the area. No pressure from staff to talk to the time share people when asked. Also, cleaning staff should clean the door panels of the dust that accumulates there, otherwise was very clean. Was a good location for the

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: NatashaStreeter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was looking for a great deal in New Orleans and boy did I find it. The hotel was better than I expected it to be and me and my husband was extremly satisfied. Staff was very friendly and helpful I have already pass this hotel information to my friends so that their stay can be just as great like ours. Job well done staff of the Avenue Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room ,great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: RobD_CM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Plaza last weekend for a wedding, and received a fantastic group rate. For the price, we expected a glorified motel experience, and instead had a great nice hotel stay. The room was huge, with a large window with city views. Room 1219. King bed, kitchenette (no oven - everything else, including dishwasher and full-sized refrigerator), great bathroom and lots of space. There is a pool, gym, and easy valet parking, all right in the heart of the Garden District. The staff were friendly and efficient, the room was spotless and the bed (with six pillows) was luxurious. The shower has a sweet huge shower-head that is very nice. I highly recommend the Avenue Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: jojomomma54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in studio #414 from Sept. 23 through the 29th. The resort, located in the historic Garden District, is completely renovated and just beautiful, the staff is fantastic. Within 2 minutes of arriving, I had been given the tip to purchase daily streetcar passes ($3.00) instead of the 5-day Jazzy pass, thereby saving money. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy. The streetcars stop right at the resort. The streetcar drivers are aware of the resort and if you ask they will let you know when it's time to get off. The consierge has a map of New Orleans, for the asking, and so you can quickly learn your way around. We found everyone, in the resort and on the streets, seemed to love coming to our assistance. Also, ask the consierge for a map of the Garden District self-guided walking tour. The gorgeous walking tour is within a 4 block area near Ave. Plaza. I walked the route after I took a "Save Our Cemeteries" tour and also The Original N.O. Movie Tour. With all I learned from those tours it really made my own Garden District walk that more meaningful. Our studio looked brand new and we have never stayed in a timeshare so well equipped. Let's start in the kitchen: granite countertops, nice size refrig., microwave, 2 burner flat stovetop, dishwasher, blender, toaster, coffeemaker, 4 piece settings of plates, glassware, utensils, dishwashing detergent for sink and dishwasher, pots and pans, 4-cup coffee packets (delicious coffee- as I used up packets I asked for more from Lobby desk), small salt and pepper, paper towels, microwave popcorn, ice bucket, coasters, dishtowels and oven mitts. A nice sized table and two chairs for meals. We had a comfortable king-size bed with 6 pillows, 2 end tables with lamps, alarm clock, 42" flat screen t.v. sitting on small armoire which my husband used for some of his clothes. The bathroom is small but the shower (with 2 shower heads) was the width of the bathroom. Plenty of towels, hairdryer, and samples of lotion, shampoo, conditioner and soap. Granite countertops in bath and small dressing area. The closet was a small walk-in with two levels of shelving, a safe, a broom, iron and ironing board. There were 3 mirrors- one in bath, dressing area and a long one by the entrance door. We pack only carry-on luggage and the storage was fine for us. If you pack BIG you may want a one-bedroom. This is a timeshare resort, no maid service, so if you want daily cleaning I'm sure you can arrange it. We do without because I'd rather not "clean up" before the maid comes in (I don't find making the bed and doing dishes all that difficult on vacation). As it was hot, sunny and humid all week, the pool was great for floating and cooling off. I loved sitting in the courtyard around the pool, surrounded by the haunted Ashley house, listening to the water in the fountain and sounds of the streetcars going by. In case of an emergency there is a phone, in the pool area, for calling the Lobby Desk. They have thought of everything! Pool towels are at the Lobby desk for the asking and can be dropped off on the Ashley House porch. The sundeck is a staircase above the 12th floor. It has tables, chairs, loungers and great sunset views. It helped orient us to the crescent- shaped city. There are numerous grocery markets and restaurants within a short walking distance to the resort. Next to the Lobby is a computer access room for guests, 3 computers with a printer. How simple,convenient and timesaving to print out my boarding passes for our flights home. The day before we left I asked the porter about transportation to the airport. He recommended Charles Ritz and made arrangements for pick-up. Charles was on time, with a roomy SUV, a bright smile and friendly personality. I wish I had known about him when we had landed in N.O. Talking to him would have been a great way to start our vacation. The best thing going for Ave. Plaza is the friendly, respectful and helpful staff. Everyone always acknowledges you and when I mentioned how beautiful the resort was, their faces lit up like they owned the place. The resort has a gorgeous and convenient location, fantastic units and the greatest staff. Southern hospitallity is alive and well at Ave. Plaza. Wyndham you done good!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: FWMSU
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was superb. Everyone we encountered greeted us with a smile and offer to assist with any questions or needs. Even a contractor doing work on another floor was very informative as we rode the elevator. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Location on St. Charles and proximity to Tulane was perferct for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: hatladybv
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week in August and just loved it. Our suite was clean and there was plenty of space. We were in town for a convention and had shipped many packages in advance. The packages were stored and and everything was in order. Concierge Big Jerome and Herb assisted us in getting transportation to take my packages to my event and on the return. Thanks to you guys you are the best. All the staff were very eager to assist and we appreciated it. Very professional staff! Hope to see you all again.

Reviews.Title: “What a pain!”
Reviews.Author: JPSLC
Reviews.Content: I did not have hot water for two days. When i notified the front desk they said they would take care of it. I ended up complaining three more times that day. It was not taken care of until the day after my initial complaint. When i asked for a refund, the hotel said that they responded the issue as soon as they were made aware (bs!). I guess a day and a half is "as soon as" they get around to things there. They also charged me twice for my room(s) and i still have not seen the credit. It was and still is, a giant pain!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base to explore the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: pirategirrl
Reviews.Content: This is our home timeshare resort but my first time returning to New Orleans since Katrina. Avenue Plaza was out of commission for about a year repairing the storm damage, so I wasn't sure what to expect. It's located in the Garden District right by the streetcar line. Fortunately, they have gotten things back in order. We own a studio unit, so in addition to it being VERY SMALL, the bedspreads & furnishings are a bit dated. But we were barely in our room so it was fine. The bathrooms are nicely remodeled but very tiny. The toilet seat would not stay up. We mentioned this to the staff, who said they were aware of this issue in the new toilets & would be addressing it. There was remodeling happening on our floor but it was quiet at night. The staff were so helpful and friendly. We were only there 3 nights this time, but can't wait to return! The St Charles street car stops in front of the resort, which makes it easy to get into the Quarter. However, the stop to catch it home is on the outskirts of the FQ and isn't a place we felt comfortable waiting around at night, so we often caught a cab home, which ran about $10-12 without tip. (Generally, we did feel safe everywhere we went, but we always try to use caution at night in ANY city.) The great thing about the Avenue Plaza is it's pretty quiet since it's away from the French Quarter, but close in proximity so we can get there quickly. It's also in a lovely part of the Garden District, and we often did walking tours to see all the old, beautiful homes in the neighborhood. The studio unit has a small table/chairs and kitchenette, so you can reheat or refrigerate all that meal you couldn't finish in one of the billions of great New Orleans eateries. Basically, we've taken Harry Connick Jr's advice about this great city and plan everything we do around our meals.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets”
Reviews.Author: KCoach
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a one bedroom suite with a sofabed, so the Avenue Plaza was perfect. Location was great. Much quieter than staying in the French Quarter, but only a ten minute streetcar (which picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel) away that part of NOLA. Very cute pool that shared a courtyard with the Ashley House (supposedly the most haunted house in America, which sounds wierd but if you are not visiting a plantation, it's nice to have a historic house in the backyard of your hotel...plus the hotel staff will give you a free tour of the house too). Most of the staff is very courteous and helpful. I checked in at 10 pm and there were no linens for the sofabed. We called but still had to wait over an hour before putting a second call in and then having to finally go down there myself to get them. So as long as you are a "DIY" kind of person, you won't have a problem. There were many people on hand to answer questions about seeing the city. The internet room was free as well as the printer, which made checking into the airport really easy. There were a few shady moments walking along St. Charles at night with people askng for spare change, but the same would probably happen in a different part of the city. There are a few restaurants in that part of town, but not many. The bonus is that you are literally across the street from the Garden District, so beautiful scenery is a stone's throw away. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place at a great location”
Reviews.Author: jeraldcross
Reviews.Content: Avenue Plaza is 21 blocks, a short 15 minute St Charles streetcar line ride, to Canal Street and the French Quarter. Senior fare is $.40 per trip, one,3,5 day passes for adults on sale at grocery store on the corner. Staff was very friendly and accomodating of anyhting we asked. Booked a couple tours, and were picked up right outside the hotel. Room was nice, bathroom a little small, but what a great shower. Others have complained about the old elevators, but they just replaced one, were working on the second last week, and will have the third done by end of April. Pool was very nice and courtyard was very peaceful; there is also a 12th floor sundeck. Very nice steakhouse at the hotel, and we had numerous restaurants within a 6 block walk. Trolly stop Cafe, Copelands, Houstons and Voodoo BBQ were very good. Ask at the concierge table for a printout of a free walking tour of the Garden District. We ate at Coquettes at end of tour-best meal of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Service”
Reviews.Author: DaveQVictoria
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in a studio unit (509) for 7 nights and were happy with the property and the location. The unit we had was not renovated but had everything we needed. The king bed was comfortable and there was more then enough room for 2 people. We also took advantage of the free laundry. Other then the timeshare sales people - the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location was great as the streetcar stops right in front of the property and it is a short ride to the Quarter or to the Garden District. We highly recommend a person gets a "Jazzy Pass" at Williams market. A 5 day pass was only $20 and was well worth it. One thing a person staying here has to keep in mind is that this is a timeshare property so there is no daily maid service but since we knew that going in it wasn't a problem. Overall, we were happy with the property and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Chicagomom45
Reviews.Content: WOW - looking via the internet I was looking forward to staying at the Avenue Plaza. Too bad there was no information about them being timeshares. The location is great - right on the St. Charles streetcar line. But we didn't get fresh towels, the beds were not made up, the floors were dirty....NOT what you want to see when you are traveling, especially when you know there are so many hotels in NO that are way classier. Would not recommend staying here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good time in New Orleans, but arrival was very frustrating!”
Reviews.Author: DingYuLan
Reviews.Content: After traveling all night on the red eye, we arrived at 6:30am at the Wyndham Avenue Plaza to find out that our reservation unbeknown to us had been cancelled. This information according to the front desk. We were told that there was nothing that could be done. It was only after 2 hours of email and phone calls that we were finally in our room. Needless to say, we were somewhat distrought. There was no explanation as to what had happened, but magically our reservation reappeared and all was well. Don't like to give a bad review, but this is what happened. Not sure whether I will book with Extra holidays again. The room itself was very nice as we were placed in a completely refurbished room. The staff was friendly and helpful after they were finally convinced that we actuallyt should be there. Maybe it is due to the refurbishing process or just that it is part of the New Orleans relaxed culture, but the elevators and hallways were not vacummed once while we were there. Just makes one wonder about cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Not if it was free...”
Reviews.Author: BadgerConn
Reviews.Content: My wife has a timeshare we used here. The reviews on TA seemed positive, so we were in for quite a shock. We were given a room on the second floor that was similar to many of the pictures online, minus the bathroom. There were towels in the hallway from the time we check in until we checked out. The room stunk..we had to turn up the A/C to make it even bareable. The whole place seemed dirty. There was a security gaurd checking all the closets that didn't make us feel very safe. The consiegre lady was very helpful booking the tours. The topper was the shower design. It was open and faced the toilet. When I turned on the shower and it sprayed all over the toilet and soaked the toilet paper. Even though our stay was included in the timeshare, we checked out and headed to a hotel in the French Quarter. I would not recommend this place, and despite the street car, I would recommend staying in the Frech Quarter because you can just walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home while away”
Reviews.Author: LuckyL
Reviews.Content: The location of Avenue Plaza was very good. The streetcar ran directly across from the hotel, though the schedule was not reliable. The unit we were in was recently renovated and nice. Small kitchenette area with a stove top cooking area and microwave. Kitchen and bathroom had granite countertops. Bed very comfortable. Bedroom on the small side with no closet but there was a small closet upon entering the unit. Staff was extremely pleasant always offering a greeting and a "Welcome Back" when we returned from a day out. Guest services staff helped with suggestions. We were concerned over the notices stating renovations taking place but we did not experience any noise. Took a great Garden District/Cemetery walking tour, which we met in front of the book shop located in "The Rink" bldg. Our guide Dave was wonderful and informative. It was only $20. For eating out near the hotel, Cheesecake Bistro was only a block away and offered a nice meal at an average price. For breakfast the Trolley Diner has a 2 eggs, 2 strips bacon & small grits for only $2.99 between 6:30 - 8:30 a.m. each day. I would recommend Avenue Plaza for it's comfortable accomodations, nice staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “This place is worth the money”
Reviews.Author: catsandra
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 7 other people for 4 days in feb.2011. The place is very beautiful and above the Sheraton etc. The bellman unloaded all my luggage with no hesitation, 12 bags, and brought to our room. The room, 1 bedroom, was excellent. Kitchen and bathroom in granite, decorated very nicely. Lots of room even wtih 4 of us in each room The view from the room, 12 floor, was great, showed all the city. The free internet room was better than pictured. The Manager and all the staff were very helpful and very nice with smiles on there faces. I would stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Quiet Location easy Access to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: RichDar
